Hackathon.body:
Hi Edward Lu,

You have a new mention from the UC Berkeley AI Hackathon 2025 workspace (https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9084394114242/team).

---

#announcements
View in the archives: https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9084394114242/archives/C08TQ4AC5PZ/p1750537800675649

Shreya Korlipara [CAL HACKS] (1:30 PM, June 21st)

:tada: *BLACK & LATINX MIXER ‚Äî HAPPENING TODAY!* :fist::skin-tone-5::sparkles:
 :round_pushpin: *Lower Sproul Tent |* :clock2: *2:00‚Äì3:00 PM (SNACKS PROVIDED!!!!!!!!!!!!)*
Come vibe with fellow hackers at our Black & Latinx Mixer ‚Äî a space to connect, share stories, and build community :speech_balloon::revolving_hearts: Whether you're here to network, make friends, or just enjoy the music & snacks, you're more than welcome! :notes::burrito::dancer::skin-tone-4:
:rotating_light: *BONUS: Attend & get a RAFFLE TICKET for a chance to win an APPLE WATCH!* :apple::watch:*Ô∏è*
 *Yes, you heard that right. Just show up and you‚Äôre in the running* :raised_hands::skin-tone-4:
:loudspeaker: All are welcome ‚Äî don‚Äôt miss this!

Valerie [CAL HACKS] (1:35 PM, June 21st)

@channel come grab ai hackathon swag on the first floor! we are passing it out near BMO bank in the back :shirt::bangbang: 



* * *

You can snooze these notifications for
an hour: https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/unsub/U092E9PS329-7a16f60e515c3ec8de50f1c39dc9c9210375b6ce03c37ba9cf09a97c5de6d03a-notify-mute-1h

Hackathon.subject: Flora [CAL HACKS] mentioned you in #announcements
Hackathon.body:
Hi Edward Lu,

You have a new mention from the UC Berkeley AI Hackathon 2025 workspace (https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9084372587426/team).

---

#announcements
View in the archives: https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9084372587426/archives/C08TQ4AC5PZ/p1750529006710089

Flora [CAL HACKS] (11:03 AM, June 21st)

@channel Thank you for coming to the Opening Ceremony! Up next, we have 3 exciting workshops starting at 11:10AM :sparkles:
‚Ä¢ :anthropic2: Anthropic - Crash Course: Building with Large Language Models & Claude (Tilden, 5th Floor)
‚Ä¢ :groq: Groq - Build a AI-powered chatbot with Groq (Stephens, 3rd Floor) (they will be vemoing $20 to one person!)
‚Ä¢ :teddy_bear: Cubstart - Training a Neural Network in the Web Browser from Scratch (2nd Floor)
All workshops and activities today will start on Berkeley time :bear:, which for those unfamiliar, means that they start *10 minutes after the hour.* Attending the workshops can get you a raffle ticket :admission_tickets: for a chance to win an Apple Watch! :apple:

:mega:  As a friendly reminder, please keep your wristband on at all times! We will not be offering replacements.

Opening ceremony slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1WMuRC1Ao6128nYjeikno9ony5Qe3R7iVDWfd-6681DE/edit?slide=id.g3692eeb67f6_5_87#slide=id.g3692eeb67f6_5_87

@channel Lovely workshops hosted by Google (Tilden) and Orkes (Stephens) are happening RIGHT NOW! Head over to learn from our amazing sponsors! :sparkles: 



* * *

You can snooze these notifications for
an hour: https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/unsub/U092E9PS329-7a16f60e515c3ec8de50f1c39dc9c9210375b6ce03c37ba9cf09a97c5de6d03a-notify-mute-1h

Shreya Korlipara [CAL HACKS] (10:22 AM, June 21st)

Starting at Berkeley time 10:40~!!!!!!! BE THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Flora [CAL HACKS] (11:03 AM, June 21st)

@channel Thank you for coming to the Opening Ceremony! Up next, we have 3 exciting workshops starting at 11:10AM :sparkles:
‚Ä¢ :anthropic2: Anthropic - Crash Course: Building with Large Language Models & Claude (Tilden, 5th Floor)
‚Ä¢ :groq: Groq - Build a AI-powered chatbot with Groq (Stephens, 3rd Floor) (they will be vemoing $20 to one person!)
‚Ä¢ :teddy_bear: Cubstart - Training a Neural Network in the Web Browser from Scratch (2nd Floor)
All workshops and activities today will start on Berkeley time :bear:, which for those unfamiliar, means that they start *10 minutes after the hour.* Attending the workshops can get you a raffle ticket :admission_tickets: for a chance to win an Apple Watch! :apple:

:mega:  As a friendly reminder, please keep your wristband on at all times! We will not be offering replacements.

Opening ceremony slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1WMuRC1Ao6128nYjeikno9ony5Qe3R7iVDWfd-6681DE/edit?slide=id.g3692eeb67f6_5_87#slide=id.g3692eeb67f6_5_87

Hackathon.subject: UC Berkeley AI Hackathon 2025 on Slack: New Account Details
Hackathon.body:
Welcome to Slack

Ta-da! You‚Äôve joined your first Slack workspace and we couldn‚Äôt be more delighted. Here are your account details, along with some tips to help you get started.

Workspace name: UC Berkeley AI Hackathon 2025

aihackathon2025.slack.com []

Open Slack [https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9105316983904/messages/C08TQ4AC5PZ]
Tips for getting started

Take a quick tour

Get familiar with the basics of Slack [https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9105316983904/resources/using-slack/your-quick-start-guide-to-slack?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-new-join] so you‚Äôre ready to get to work in no time.

Start working in channels

Keep conversations organized in channels [https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9105316983904/features/channels?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-new-join] ‚Äî organized spaces for everything related to a project, topic, or team.

Download Slack

For the best experience with Slack, download our apps [https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9105316983904/downloads?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-new-join&t=T08TQ49TBBR] for desktop and mobile.

See more tips [https://aihackathon2025.slack.com/x-p8942145929399-9082329887077-9105316983904/resources/using-slack/top-5-tips-for-getting-started-in-slack?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-new-join]

If you have any questions as you‚Äôre getting started, drop us a note at help@slack.com. We‚Äôre glad you‚Äôre here!

Hackathon.subject: AI Hackathon Last Minute Logistics!
Hackathon.body:
Access your hacker pass & get packed!

Hi hackers,

We hope you‚Äôre as excited as we are for this weekend! Reminder, check-in begins *at 9am on Saturday at the* *Bancroft &¬†Telegraph entrance to the Martin Luther King Jr. Student Union at UC Berkeley (second floor).*

*Opening ceremony will begin at 10am.*

*Please have your Hacker Pass and Government ID ready so we can check you in as fast as possible.*

Slack will be the primary way for you to stay aware of what's going on during the Hackathon. Join our Slack using one of these links ASAP. If one of the links doesn't work, try another one. [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36gac4d0i-KdepUZ9TFw5VNZIMza6iew ) [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36c6tdorr-dg0i9ZSV5lpIBQzM5qT6Ww ) [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36eb8bb3r-xgJu1jLJC0_6BDJlMRu5xw )

If you're still looking for teammates, reach out on Slack or join our teammate mixer, which will be from 10:30am-12:00pm on Lower Sproul Plaza on Saturday.

*Continue reading this message for key logistical details, including:*
* Hacker Pass
* Live Site + Hacker Guide
* Workshop Recordings
* Packing List

*Hacker Pass*
You‚Äôll be using your hacker pass to check into the hackathon and your meals! Do NOT share your hacker pass with anyone else‚Äîeach pass is unique to each hacker and cannot be used to check in more than once.

You should be able to access your hacker pass by logging into the live site and navigating to the profile tab *the day of the hackathon*. Your hacker pass may not be available right now.

*Live Site*
Check out live.hackberkeley.org ( https://live.hackberkeley.org/ ) during the hackathon for the most up-to-date schedule! The live site will be fully updated by the start of the hackathon. The live site may not be updated right now (if it still looks like the countdown from Cal Hacks 11.0, don't worry!).

Remember to go over the Hacker Guide ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BCGcqQjpNzxp-jA1cCaLW3Yp1_sLkY-WJr8PLfY35Jo/edit?usp=sharing ) for more details about prizes, workshops, and FAQ.

*Workshop Recordings*
Missed our workshops earlier this week? Check out recordings and resources:

* I ntro to building web applications with React workshop

* Recording ( https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Vkz74a9RHH8jV6Lec5YIcqrUqxUaz0qu )
* Intro to Swift Cubstart Video ( https://youtu.be/isgPO9ozsoM )
* Intro to Swift UI Video ( https://youtu.be/VQKF_IIpyFE )
* Start Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/iOS-starter-workshop-ai-2025 )
* Final Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/iOS-finished-workshop-ai-2025 )

* Intro to building iOS applications workshop

* Recording ( https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=dPTKOOnrX_4&t=2090s )
* Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/web-workshop-ai-2025 )
* Public Slides ( https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1t3ry2R31y12BgkhClDVf_0Fsq0B6FO2RdD8psyhL_HU/edit?slide=id.p#slide=id.p )

*What to Bring*
- Government ID, school ID, or passport
- Laptop & Chargers
- Reusable water bottle
- Deodorant/toiletries/change of clothes
- Sleeping bag/blanket/pillow if you plan on staying the night

*What Not to Bring*
Please note that the following items are NOT allowed at the venue and are subject to confiscation, removal from the building, and permanent blacklist from our events.
- No flammable items, including but not limited to fuels, gasoline, gas torches, lighter fluid
- No weapons (guns, knives, pocket knives, fireworks, etc.)
- No illegal drugs or alcoholic beverages
- No tents
- See the list of all UCPD prohibited items here. ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1awCUI9MdapZqhdQtxTH1fJVlrUw44L-W/edit?usp=drive_link&ouid=118330126809447237480&rtpof=true&sd=true )

Get ready for an exciting weekend filled with llamas, workshops, meet-ups, sponsors, and (of course) amazing hackers like YOU! We look forward to seeing you all in-person soon!

And exciting news... our keynote speaker will be Anastasios Angelopoulos ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/anastasiosa?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name ) , Co-Founder and CEO at LMArena ( https://lmarena.ai/ ) and UC Berkeley alum!

If you have any questions before the hackathon, the best place to ask them is in the #ask-directors channel on Slack.

Diya + Hackathons @ Berkeley Team

Diya Vij

253 Cory Hall , Berkeley , CA 

Unsubscribe ( https://u5970253.ct.sendgrid.net/asm/unsubscribe/?user_id=5970253&data=_D3GFysBlXTLhp5PEOqTGQYkKih07HqhPUiY1eMIl4JoMDAwdTAwMLbb_wplNcT-efok8T9BPGnjXAFJrxaJ9E0m_-_pxpv20A4UgCeT3yXtunGyGL_m36m585cR7udZuXGjHm7osut_Ipi7fXwjHFW41rFJbqjeUscO0SRoxtXKr_JRFtbS7iUA6M0iWeGTUbpshn3TBn_RdqTjohxKULlEN7-U3oVEQ8LM9NeVHtbbpc1NPjOVC-RV_oCS-JPXjSkkFpce4SGSVsXiXjan_hsbjegbP19wVDTa02j1Cj2xFomkfufeocZcmYcOhEy5Mp5R4ca_IBCs-Jpm_EcPRXYM27WEoq57ygz05G69N4QEDVHZyoHNyuf7Z13Ilu0QS-z9uoHwQpSWzKOZ7P25qBJjWF8TmwBuGoq-0gW_NkAsuZAkyr0zVUfd21HMimUgLaxMQbizpmYoA2v685_AFSD4CYExKeSA2Lw6tGahDRe7fBX8GkUvmu05D84vyEowPs63DM_UITKeE8kDy--FQfhrpU4FAWpeU2buszOuRSTEIyv9R5GsICPOqvQuZjq-TyN7TUUSRDUoBcHvvVcRr-tSDgVp1OgQx2MICqXfdhSfHjMdg5Mqdql-Ry8cAYDyFQK8gsMi9H2UTbR3BVVS1ZudPxuCmXXHJ40fmka7J3bFOOoNfkdjq3C86V4HfdGHh3vPko_vTQ9xHl3uvNSogudc8kpwNNRnByjefMcKTNdiXPrb7NXjqUUB2OcPGNFdlvPsiMg0X8eGj9BKecb_GzVFydqwVkLywqbiXz5YW413hnprm3seb3T_LAwgv4XQtL66H5RNC5VWAZmH9Zarki9jUXKc30M5kvVZtxaVzihju78hRHrV-GBrBJL88nzPJsSlkgQW-2qkjPT2dchQTVf3BEYjzBl9gQ5nUss2zjVwAYSt_8DdlhVwSmr1NCqMcLALfYGduXWYXztGZRsyQWD-bvd1OrfjOwWMAy3EowYaB5bTDEftYDHBICA-cV3M_2nA7uavSmqibnJ3zgHQVPhgGj2d6bG7k2Angvoy77D5ID_dWGTc5OjFIWUW6mo0QR80VCfDf__JAUIn1zzgXIqBT6rsc012EF21myrIggfP7axt4MYmHMhtDtUME-yNhz8daZb_FdAEakAgJP2KrQ_mNQn6ukLy3Tddk3YhnZrG6uakoRxuVg== )

* Recording ( https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Vkz74a9RHH8jV6Lec5YIcqrUqxUaz0qu )
* Intro to Swift Cubstart Video ( https://youtu.be/isgPO9ozsoM )
* Intro to Swift UI Video ( https://youtu.be/VQKF_IIpyFE )
* Start Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/iOS-starter-workshop-ai-2025 )
* Final Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/iOS-finished-workshop-ai-2025 )

* Intro to building iOS applications workshop

* Recording ( https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=dPTKOOnrX_4&t=2090s )
* Project Repo ( https://github.com/cubstart/web-workshop-ai-2025 )
* Public Slides ( https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1t3ry2R31y12BgkhClDVf_0Fsq0B6FO2RdD8psyhL_HU/edit?slide=id.p#slide=id.p )

*What to Bring*
- Government ID, school ID, or passport
- Laptop & Chargers
- Reusable water bottle
- Deodorant/toiletries/change of clothes
- Sleeping bag/blanket/pillow if you plan on staying the night

*What Not to Bring*
Please note that the following items are NOT allowed at the venue and are subject to confiscation, removal from the building, and permanent blacklist from our events.
- No flammable items, including but not limited to fuels, gasoline, gas torches, lighter fluid
- No weapons (guns, knives, pocket knives, fireworks, etc.)
- No illegal drugs or alcoholic beverages
- No tents
- See the list of all UCPD prohibited items here. ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1awCUI9MdapZqhdQtxTH1fJVlrUw44L-W/edit?usp=drive_link&ouid=118330126809447237480&rtpof=true&sd=true )

Get ready for an exciting weekend filled with llamas, workshops, meet-ups, sponsors, and (of course) amazing hackers like YOU! We look forward to seeing you all in-person soon!

And exciting news... our keynote speaker will be Anastasios Angelopoulos ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/anastasiosa?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name ) , Co-Founder and CEO at LMArena ( https://lmarena.ai/ ) and UC Berkeley alum!

If you have any questions before the hackathon, the best place to ask them is in the #ask-directors channel on Slack.

Diya + Hackathons @ Berkeley Team

Diya Vij

253 Cory Hall , Berkeley , CA 

Unsubscribe ( https://u5970253.ct.sendgrid.net/asm/unsubscribe/?user_id=5970253&data=_D3GFysBlXTLhp5PEOqTGQYkKih07HqhPUiY1eMIl4JoMDAwdTAwMLbb_wplNcT-efok8T9BPGnjXAFJrxaJ9E0m_-_pxpv20A4UgCeT3yXtunGyGL_m36m585cR7udZuXGjHm7osut_Ipi7fXwjHFW41rFJbqjeUscO0SRoxtXKr_JRFtbS7iUA6M0iWeGTUbpshn3TBn_RdqTjohxKULlEN7-U3oVEQ8LM9NeVHtbbpc1NPjOVC-RV_oCS-JPXjSkkFpce4SGSVsXiXjan_hsbjegbP19wVDTa02j1Cj2xFomkfufeocZcmYcOhEy5Mp5R4ca_IBCs-Jpm_EcPRXYM27WEoq57ygz05G69N4QEDVHZyoHNyuf7Z13Ilu0QS-z9uoHwQpSWzKOZ7P25qBJjWF8TmwBuGoq-0gW_NkAsuZAkyr0zVUfd21HMimUgLaxMQbizpmYoA2v685_AFSD4CYExKeSA2Lw6tGahDRe7fBX8GkUvmu05D84vyEowPs63DM_UITKeE8kDy--FQfhrpU4FAWpeU2buszOuRSTEIyv9R5GsICPOqvQuZjq-TyN7TUUSRDUoBcHvvVcRr-tSDgVp1OgQx2MICqXfdhSfHjMdg5Mqdql-Ry8cAYDyFQK8gsMi9H2UTbR3BVVS1ZudPxuCmXXHJ40fmka7J3bFOOoNfkdjq3C86V4HfdGHh3vPko_vTQ9xHl3uvNSogudc8kpwNNRnByjefMcKTNdiXPrb7NXjqUUB2OcPGNFdlvPsiMg0X8eGj9BKecb_GzVFydqwVkLywqbiXz5YW413hnprm3seb3T_LAwgv4XQtL66H5RNC5VWAZmH9Zarki9jUXKc30M5kvVZtxaVzihju78hRHrV-GBrBJL88nzPJsSlkgQW-2qkjPT2dchQTVf3BEYjzBl9gQ5nUss2zjVwAYSt_8DdlhVwSmr1NCqMcLALfYGduXWYXztGZRsyQWD-bvd1OrfjOwWMAy3EowYaB5bTDEftYDHBICA-cV3M_2nA7uavSmqibnJ3zgHQVPhgGj2d6bG7k2Angvoy77D5ID_dWGTc5OjFIWUW6mo0QR80VCfDf__JAUIn1zzgXIqBT6rsc012EF21myrIggfP7axt4MYmHMhtDtUME-yNhz8daZb_FdAEakAgJP2KrQ_mNQn6ukLy3Tddk3YhnZrG6uakoRxuVg== )

Hackathon.subject: Pre-Hackathon Workshops This Week! + Hacker Guide
Hackathon.body:
Come to our workshops this week, and check out our hacker guide for up to date information!

Hi hackers,

We're excited to see you this weekend at the MLK Student Union in Berkeley, CA for the UC Berkeley AI Hackathon. Reminder, check-in starts at 9am on Saturday!

We're hosting two workshops this week (Monday and Wednesday evening), and hope to see you there!

*Continue reading this message for key logistical details, including:*

* *Pre-Event Workshops*
* *Devpost + Hacker Guide*
* *Meet Some (More!) Sponsors*
* *Prohibited Items*

*If you haven't joined our Slack yet, be sure to do so!* Slack is the go-to place for announcements, and we recommend you join now to introduce yourself and meet other hackers. Use any of the following links (if one doesn't work, try another!): [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36l7xaa01-zrshSTGXA5_Y9YZrfu9XHw ) [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36gac4d0i-KdepUZ9TFw5VNZIMza6iew ) [Link] ( https://join.slack.com/t/aihackathon2025/shared_invite/zt-36c6tdorr-dg0i9ZSV5lpIBQzM5qT6Ww )

*Pre-Event Workshops*
üì¢ We're hosting two pre-hackathon workshops to get you up to speed and hacking!

* üåç Intro to building web applications with React (Monday 6/16, 6:30 PM PST, Zoom link ( https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/95202954440?pwd=mFNyJggmOj4a6sXFQ1lxXzba8Nkk8d.1 ) )
* üì± Intro to building iOS applications (Wednesday 6/18, 6:30 PM PST, Zoom link ( https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/92997345614?pwd=lFc8iRW7QrOhJbIiM6BrONgbUBCYlo.1 ) )

Join us to skill up and get ready for the hackathon! Both of these workshops will give you the¬†üß∞ skills you need to have to build something at the AI hackathon.

*Devpost + Hacker Guide*
Check out our Devpost for the event *here!* ( https://uc-berkeley-ai-hackathon-2025.devpost.com/ )

Questions, concerns, want to read more about the hackathon? *Check out our hacker guide* ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BCGcqQjpNzxp-jA1cCaLW3Yp1_sLkY-WJr8PLfY35Jo/edit?usp=sharing ) , which contains everything from our food schedule, what workshops we'll have, and our recommended packing list.

During the event, we'll be updating our live site (which will be linked on the hacker guide soon!) with the latest workshops, mealtimes, and activities going on.

*Meet Some (More!) of Our Sponsors*
*Google* : Google Cloud is the new way to the cloud, providing AI, infrastructure, developer, data, security, and collaboration tools built for today and tomorrow. Google Cloud will sponsor a "Best use of Gemini API" prize, awarded to the most impactful and innovative projects that are built using Gemini API.

*Vercel* : Vercel gives developers the tools and cloud infrastructure to build, scale, and secure faster and beautifully. As the team behind v0, Next.js, and AI SDK, we help customers like Ramp, Supreme, PayPal, Chick-fil-A, and Under Armour build for the AI-native web. We're also hosting a v0 workshop this year at Cal Hacks - see you there!

*LMNT* : LMNT ( https://lmnt.com ) makes it super easy to build apps that speak with low-latency speech and amazing AI voices. It‚Äôs free and unlimited during the hackathon, so go wild. Swing by our booth to chat with us, drop off your resume, and check out some live demos... and if you just can't wait for Cal Hacks, hop into our Discord ( https://discord.gg/PXvGTVvXqQ ) now and get a head start.

*Mastra.ai:* Mastra is the Typescript framework for building agents. We have a great local environment, agents, workflows, RAG, tracing, evals, memory, tool calling, etc. We also wrote a book called Principles of Building AI Agents and we have copies for everyone!

*Fly.io:* Fly.io gives you ridiculously fast, scalable code-execution sandboxes that spin up in milliseconds. We can run any Docker image you throw at us, whether you're hacking on web apps, tinkering with AI agents, or just messing around. Fly Machines scale down to zero when you're not using them, so you're not flushing money down the drain for idle compute. Here's $50 in credits to get started. ( https://fly.io/hello/fly-with-us. )

*a37* : a37 is an AI research and product lab training fully autonomous DevOps engineers. In just five months, they've created the first agents capable of reasoning across entire enterprise DevOps stack and raised a $10M seed round led by tier 1 funds. The team consists of 2nd time founders from MIT, Caltech, Harvard, and Upenn with previous experience scaling a VC-backed devtools company to 7-figure revenue. Today‚Äôs DevOps landscape is a patchwork of disconnected, hard-to-manage tools. The resulting operational tax causes org wide issues: heightened security risk, rising cloud spend, and slower release cycles. The rise of AI software engineering agents has exacerbated these issues, causing more stress on DevOps teams than ever before.

*NobelEra Group:* NobelEra Group, initiated by Nobel family members and a partner of Berkeley RDI, supports young innovators via the FutureTech Club. We are offering up to $4,000 in cash awards for Agents Track solutions - be sure to submit your Agents projects! Learn more about support for your innovations & apply to NobelEra FutureTech Club here ( https://nobelera.com/join-us?link=Ab5B1SNibcW6 ).

*Prohibited Items*
Please note that the following items are NOT allowed at the venue and are subject to confiscation, removal from the building, and permanent blacklist from our events.
- No flammable items, including but not limited to fuels, gasoline, gas torches, lighter fluid
- No weapons (guns, knives, pocket knives, fireworks, etc.)
- No illegal drugs or alcoholic beverages
- No tents
- See the list of all UCPD prohibited items here. ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1awCUI9MdapZqhdQtxTH1fJVlrUw44L-W/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=118330126809447237480&rtpof=true&sd=true )

If you have any questions before the hackathon, the best place to ask them is in the #ask-directors channel. You can also ask the team at team@hackberkeley.org ( team@hackberkeley.org?subject=&body= ).

We look forward to seeing you all in-person soon!

Diya + Hackathons @ Berkeley Team

Diya Vij

253 Cory Hall , Berkeley , CA 

Unsubscribe ( https://u5970253.ct.sendgrid.net/asm/unsubscribe/?user_id=5970253&data=3kFv-a6IJcbcXTGSkweTbL3tSSDTFyQM-AkdGTUQlnJoMDAwdTAwMAv96mo0WGwWPBkOkjAcuKyH5rSS6PTdcuVDF5AtBHRfnc_6b_-cSXgbdVqcXfcokeLxG9Zmm5ggqmF7e2SdR1EXpXS-Os2pdtj55dKusArYTIGLZuwRzZrbNOJqqFawp6a9sidUMdN2eNXYQG4z3YANRWXKfFzx6gdZvVM6B-WzL9miyLsgb8CdoN9ayQyE0_GFy6pS8rBXlE-a_5Qyy4byC73y3KskGEVQWuSItXwMjgyHRy_1KtcfDtHVn98ay_Gr2vZPT-FjmJe27KCTWMmdEogRap-ZJaib5EpU_Sdr6_Bk4vsp68FzwlhZ7MK-AsPdDTGQuPSo02RBXwk9XcLXmOy8gDL3l856sGnw3KHOqdc3WCEb8Oz11fo5FDIzuYl1evTvgKLSYr-eTJ4wbh0h0tT5y1_gYxw7HfbI1a20uMBNyhSEt-5HXBupXDVndj6MszQ4Pa6A3JhELs2yc9EiPtbJhTulxJ6X4D4-sGmBzzrdxH77-nufVf085ZFiUGQOMgga50uQKrRnfVNUpt0dp07bCIKc_S2PD9YFZp0yfCOoxSSeXQhaHidQ3f7i1rh5km5T-C-GesnRq0ZFXjD2btjpRTJv3U88XUrogif91T0dgubaf3-Z0wt4m1GAtCNvZMJW9SZqXG9pyq7wFPtz1SVWT1pW1LB_oSYJWiI7o6NJbvOB30o6bOl4vwafnHkkY1QgLyFkopWlkamxJhxwXhHUCaCgit8zMSobksjVvNn4siVuTDiykQaDo-iq4-iFGkSz7sxvCEcsikkIZRKhux-k-UfceHoeoF4ChnYi15XxxfZ6JaUPnY9pxHkQ7kgak97bf8AtwPoSIpAuDS76NV9jWve6qCqTWojm07YiWlmp1iM1hFW0HgIa13AwZR5kYGsWS25acnk3TCrpFg0tzTAvbcsdAHCsWXP8bBBlMBNCqkGTLF_ZIbKb00Sm13p0qv1HrN9aXnQkox8mkn3Xt1VRYuGcylBmHEBIrxeWhbNS8YlM9pKO6Z1pa8X4bJ48Wig8th52vqGdPm3WRY-lghyCZYUnGcSiE-U5iMe5iHw7gZ7GOtsM_6lqIxP0k3JSa5LN1tzEyzH057ysmZ_2mFUwAuR3jYDsA4p-3gnAy-MH9P37CH-YlC0kqEEKLIgy8rj7zARMU92cG_9uepH9arvyrofyHenj2w2G_HrISdVJMm8WrbOjRZr2HLJTow== )

Cursor.subject: Making the most of Cursor
Cursor.body: Hi Edward,Your free plan for Cursor is now active. Thank you for trying out the editor.Here are a few things you can try in Cursor:- Type and press Tab to accept an autocomplete or a suggested diff from Cursor Tab- Open Agent in Chat to make multi-file edits and hand off simpler tasks- Select 20 lines of code and press Cmd+K to make an inline editYou can find more tips in the docs.Feel free to shoot any questions or thoughts to our forum.Best,The Cursor DevsIf you don't want to hear from me again, please let me know.
Cursor.content: Hi Edward,Your free plan for Cursor is now active. Thank you for trying out the editor.Here are a few things you can try in Cursor:- Type and press Tab to accept an autocomplete or a suggested diff from Cursor Tab- Open Agent in Chat to make multi-file edits and hand off simpler tasks- Select 20 lines of code and press Cmd+K to make an inline editYou can find more tips in the docs.Feel free to shoot any questions or thoughts to our forum.Best,The Cursor DevsIf you don't want to hear from me again, please let me know.

Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå 
Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå 
Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå 
Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå Õè‚Äå



 <https://www.adoptapet.com>
 <https://www.adoptapet.com>

‚Ää

Hi,



We saw you applied for a pet listed by a Private Owner. That‚Äôs great news! And 
while we want to expect the best, we also want to help you plan for the worst. 
Aka scammers.


 Unfortunately, scammers will try to pose as people looking to rehome pets. 
We‚Äôll do everything we can to prevent that from happening. But here‚Äôs what you 
can do too.



And if you experience any of these, report the pet‚Äôs name and post to us here 
<https://rehome.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new>.
‚Ää



‚Ää

We tell you all this not to freak you out, just to protect you from any 
potentially bad situations. So if something does seem suspicious, report it to 
us asap here. Because if something seems like a scam, itprobably is.


 Thanks for helping keep Adopt a Pet safe!


‚Ää





‚Ää 

Our sister brand



 
<https://kinship.com/?utm_source=aap&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=sponsorlogo&utm_content=emailfooter>



Our partners



 
<https://www.zoetispetcare.com/?utm_source=adoptapet.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=pos_2022_oct_zpc_adoptapet_partnership_acquisition&utm_content=zpc_logo>
 
<https://www.pedigree.com/?utm_source=APA+Email&utm_medium=Footer+Logo&utm_campaign=Sponsorship&utm_id=AdoptAPet+Sponsorship>
 <https://petsmart.haujjd.net/c/4894945/1832083/11083> 



Adopt a Pet is here to help rescues, shelters, and rehomers bring people and 
pets together. All so we can make pet adoption easier for everyone.


Thanks for being part of that mission‚Äîand a big thanks to our sponsors, Zoetis,
 
<https://www.zoetispetcare.com/?utm_source=adoptapet.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=pos_2022_oct_zpc_adoptapet_partnership_acquisition&utm_content=zpc_logo>
Petsmart <https://petsmart.haujjd.net/c/4894945/1832083/11083>, 
<https://partnersolutions.nationwide.com/premier-landing/Adoptapet?utm_source=adptapet&utm_medium=email&utm_content=nw_email_logo>
 PEDIGREE, 
<https://www.pedigree.com/?utm_source=APA+Email&utm_medium=Footer+Logo&utm_campaign=Sponsorship&utm_id=AdoptAPet+Sponsorship>
 andKinship 
<https://kinship.co/?utm_source=aap&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=sponsorlogo&utm_content=emailfooter>
, for helping us make it happen too.




Contact us with any questions here 
<https://adoptapetusers.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/>


Our mailing address is:

Kinship Partners, Inc. 
440 Park Avenue, South. Fl. 5,
New York, NY 10016


¬© 2025 Kinship Partners, Inc., an affiliate of Mars Inc.

Others.subject: Invisalign Terms
Others.body:
*Invisalign Treatment Repayment Agreement*

*This Agreement* is made on this ___ day of ________*, 20*, by and between:

*Lender*: [Full Name of the Person Paying], residing at [Address]
*Borrower*: [Your Full Name], residing at [Your Address]

*Purpose*:
The Lender has agreed to cover the cost of Invisalign treatment on behalf
of the Borrower, with the understanding that the Borrower will repay the
total amount under the terms set forth below.
------------------------------
1. *Amount Loaned*

The Lender agrees to pay $7,500.00 (Seven Thousand Five Hundred Dollars)
toward the Borrower's Invisalign treatment.
------------------------------
2. *Repayment Terms*

   -

   *Grace Period*: The Borrower is not obligated to make any payments until
   four (4) years from the date of this agreement.
   -

   *Repayment Start Date*: Repayment will begin on or before ________*, 20*
   (four years from date above).
   -

   *Sources of Repayment*: Repayment may be made through any combination of
   the following:
   -

      Personal income/funds
      -

      Commissions from insurance policies
      -

      Earnings from stocks or investments
      -

      Any other lawful and verifiable sources of income

------------------------------
3. *Repayment Method*

Payments can be made via bank transfer, Venmo, PayPal, check, or other
agreed-upon method. The Lender and Borrower will mutually agree on a
reasonable payment schedule once the repayment period begins.
------------------------------
4. *No Interest*

This is a no-interest loan. The Borrower is only obligated to repay the
principal amount of $7,500.00.
------------------------------
5. *Prepayment*

The Borrower may repay the loan in part or in full at any time prior to the
end of the grace period without penalty.
------------------------------
6. *Acknowledgment*

Both parties understand that this agreement is based on trust and mutual
understanding, and agree to communicate in good faith regarding repayment
progress.
------------------------------
7. *Modifications*

Any changes to this agreement must be made in writing and signed by both
parties.
------------------------------
8. *Signatures*

*Borrower*:
Signature: __________________________
Full Name: _________________________
Date: _____________________________

*Lender*:
Signature: __________________________
Full Name: _________________________
Date: _____________________________

4. *No Interest*

This is a no-interest loan. The Borrower is only obligated to repay the
principal amount of $7,500.00.
------------------------------
5. *Prepayment*

The Borrower may repay the loan in part or in full at any time prior to the
end of the grace period without penalty.
------------------------------
6. *Acknowledgment*

Both parties understand that this agreement is based on trust and mutual
understanding, and agree to communicate in good faith regarding repayment
progress.
------------------------------
7. *Modifications*

Any changes to this agreement must be made in writing and signed by both
parties.
------------------------------
8. *Signatures*

*Borrower*:
Signature: __________________________
Full Name: _________________________
Date: _____________________________

*Lender*:
Signature: __________________________
Full Name: _________________________
Date: _____________________________

 <https://www.adoptapet.com>
 <https://www.adoptapet.com>

‚Ää

Hi,



We saw you applied for a pet listed by a Private Owner. That‚Äôs great news! And 
while we want to expect the best, we also want to help you plan for the worst. 
Aka scammers.


 Unfortunately, scammers will try to pose as people looking to rehome pets. 
We‚Äôll do everything we can to prevent that from happening. But here‚Äôs what you 
can do too.



And if you experience any of these, report the pet‚Äôs name and post to us here 
<https://rehome.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new>.
‚Ää



‚Ää

We tell you all this not to freak you out, just to protect you from any 
potentially bad situations. So if something does seem suspicious, report it to 
us asap here. Because if something seems like a scam, itprobably is.


 Thanks for helping keep Adopt a Pet safe!


‚Ää





‚Ää 

Our sister brand



 
<https://kinship.com/?utm_source=aap&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=sponsorlogo&utm_content=emailfooter>



Our partners



 
<https://www.zoetispetcare.com/?utm_source=adoptapet.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=pos_2022_oct_zpc_adoptapet_partnership_acquisition&utm_content=zpc_logo>
 
<https://www.pedigree.com/?utm_source=APA+Email&utm_medium=Footer+Logo&utm_campaign=Sponsorship&utm_id=AdoptAPet+Sponsorship>
 <https://petsmart.haujjd.net/c/4894945/1832083/11083> 



Adopt a Pet is here to help rescues, shelters, and rehomers bring people and 
pets together. All so we can make pet adoption easier for everyone.


Thanks for being part of that mission‚Äîand a big thanks to our sponsors, Zoetis,
 
<https://www.zoetispetcare.com/?utm_source=adoptapet.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=pos_2022_oct_zpc_adoptapet_partnership_acquisition&utm_content=zpc_logo>
Petsmart <https://petsmart.haujjd.net/c/4894945/1832083/11083>, 
<https://partnersolutions.nationwide.com/premier-landing/Adoptapet?utm_source=adptapet&utm_medium=email&utm_content=nw_email_logo>
 PEDIGREE, 
<https://www.pedigree.com/?utm_source=APA+Email&utm_medium=Footer+Logo&utm_campaign=Sponsorship&utm_id=AdoptAPet+Sponsorship>
 andKinship 
<https://kinship.co/?utm_source=aap&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=sponsorlogo&utm_content=emailfooter>
, for helping us make it happen too.




Contact us with any questions here 
<https://adoptapetusers.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/>


Our mailing address is:

Kinship Partners, Inc. 
440 Park Avenue, South. Fl. 5,
New York, NY 10016

Others.subject: Reminder to Send Documents
Others.body:
Dear Edward,

We appreciate your patience as we process official document submissions. As a reminder, the postmark deadline for your official transcripts is July 1. We will continue to process all documents throughout July into early August..

Once received, official document manual processing may take two to three weeks. Once we receive and process your document, it will be marked as "Received" and then moved to your completed list of tasks on your CalCentral checklist upon review and confirmation. Please DO NOT submit your transcript more than once, as it will slow the process. Additionally, please DO NOT submit a missing transcript request if a document is marked as "Received."

            If a document is marked as "Incomplete," required information is missing from the document. Our office will contact you for further details. Please DO NOT submit a missing transcript request if a document is marked as "Incomplete." If you have further questions, please submit an Undergraduate Admissions Update Form.

Office Closures
            Limited operations will take place the week of June 16-20, with normal business operations resuming on Monday, June 23. Please note that the Office of Undergraduate Admissions will be closed on July 4. Limited operations will also take place June 30 through July 4, with normal business operations resuming on Monday, July 7. Thank you for your patience.  

AP Exams
            The published deadline for AP exam scores on CalCentral is July 15, 2025; if you have issues submitting AP exam scores, please submit an update form.  

An admissions officer will reach out to you directly if there are any issues with your documents. Please continue to check your applicant email throughout the summer. Please DO NOT email undergradtranscripts@berkeley.edu regarding your transcript status. This email is only used to receive official electronic transcripts.

            GO BEARS!

            Sincerely,
            Office of Undergraduate Admissions
            UC Berkeley          

Office of Undergraduate Admissions <http://admissions.berkeley.edu/> | University of California, Berkeley 110 Sproul Hall #5800 Berkeley, CA 94720-5800


This email was sent to edwardluuuu@gmail.com by UC Berkeley Admissions.
Unsubscribe from UC Berkeley. <https://apply.berkeley.edu/go?r=optout&mid=e2b6c7b5-7a3b-4f30-9e86-e6677039db69>

Career.subject: SLI Opportunities Newsletter - Events, Internships, and more!
Career.body: Email from Science Learning Institute Exciting new opportunities! STEM Center Hours and information STEM Clubs Check out Foothill's STEM Clubs Mental Health Corner Foothill Mental Health Services Spring 2025 | Week 11 June 17, 2025 Hello Owls! ÔªøJust a two more weeks for the quarter, Owls! You got this! Visit the SLI website Questions? Email sli.foothill@gmail.com ‚Ää ‚Ää What Would You do Without the SLI Newsletter? Does the SLI newsletter provide you with opportunities? Where would you be without our newsletter? Does it matter in your life? We'd love to hear from you about the impact of the SLI newsletter in your life. Please fill out our super short survey to share your feedback! Survey ‚Ää No opportunities this week! ‚Ää Science & Technology Speaker Series 2025 Wed, June 25 6:30 - 8 pm Cupertino Community Hall Join Dr. Eugene L. Tu, Center Director of NASA Ames, for a fascinating talk on the future of air and space exploration from right here in Silicon Valley. Hosted by the Cupertino Chamber of Commerce. Attend this free event and learn more about NASA Ames and its impact on innovation and discovery. Register Free Passes to the 2025 OCP Global Summit Mon, Oct 13 - Thur, Oct 16 San Jose Students and educators are invited to attend the 2025 OCP Global Summit for free. This major industry event will bring together over 5,000 professionals and offers a great chance to connect with experts, learn about the latest tech, and meet Foundation Ambassadors. Interest Form Intel Facilities Technician Intern Applications now open! Step into the world of semiconductor manufacturing with Intel‚Äôs Facilities Technician Internship! This paid summer role offers hands-on experience maintaining and troubleshooting critical systems like HVAC, electrical, and mechanical infrastructure. Perfect for students interested in engineering, tech operations, or facilities management. When applying, be sure to mark ‚ÄúOther‚Äù when asked for your campus. Apply Check out our archive of past newsletters to find previously posted opportunities! https://foothill.edu/sli/past-newsletters.html Edited by - Danna Avila                   Science Learning Institute | 12345 El Monte Road | Los Altos Hills, CA 94022 US Unsubscribe | Constant Contact Data Notice

University.subject: Accommodations & Exemptions for Golden Bear Orientation
University.body: Dear Edward, We are preparing for your upcoming Golden Bear Orientation (GBO) on campus from August 21-25. As part of this preparation, we would like to know if you have special needs or accommodations, such as those outlined below. For specific details, read our Policies and refer to the GBO Sample Schedule page. ACCOMMODATIONS UC Berkeley is committed to providing full access to all of our programs and services for our students with disabilities, religious requirements, and/or dietary requirements. Please see our Disabilities Accommodations page for further details regarding how we have built access into our general GBO program and what support you may need to best engage during GBO. NSS works alongside the Disabled Students' Program to review and provide accommodations. While we will support requests that come close to GBO, please submit this form as soon as possible. If needed, submit the Golden Bear Orientation Fall 2025: Exemptions, Accommodations, and Referrals form. EXEMPTIONS Participation in Golden Bear Orientation (GBO) is integral to your successful transition to UC Berkeley. It is the University's expectation that you attend GBO and it is considered mandatory. Examples of potentially warranted exemptions include, but are not limited to, documented medical need, inability to secure student visa, dependent care, severe illness, unexpected family emergencies, active military duty, or financial hardship if there is a need to take time away for full-time employment. Please fill out the GBO Exemption Form (link below) if you have extenuating circumstances preventing you from participating in GBO in person. Your application will be reviewed and you will be notified vial email if you have been granted an exemption. We often find that UC Berkeley students, while often being advocates of those around them, do not always advocate for themselves, feel like they can ask for support, or know what support may be available. We encourage you to share what you are experiencing (if you feel comfortable), even if other environments have not made adjustments for your circumstances because we are committed to your transition to UC Berkeley. Fall Start Exemption Form Deadline to submit the Golden Bear Orientation Fall 2025: Exemptions, Accommodations, and Referrals form: July 20. Notification via email of your status: August 1. You may always reach out to NSS staff about any concerns, issues, or challenges you have by emailing us at nss@berkeley.edu. Reminder: if you haven't already, request to join the campus-wide Discord server where you can connect with other students and share resources. Sincerely, Nancy New Student Services Student Representative Team

University.subject: Your Golden Bear Orientation- Key Dates & Deadlines
University.body: Hello Edward, Below is a step-by-step overview, which will take you from academic advising and class enrollment to move-in (for those living on campus) and orientation. Pariticipation for all newly admitted undergraduate students is required for Golden Bear Advising, Golden Bear Prep (online components), and Golden Bear Orientation (in-person component). Note that you'll be able to access Golden Bear Advising in CalCentral on June 24. Step 1: Getting Started Review this for the basics of getting started at Berkeley Step 2: Golden Bear Advising (access via CalCentral on June 24) Covers campus academic resources, and how to enroll Step 3: Golden Bear Prep Comprehensive overview of UC Berkeley and your overall transition to campus Step 4: Move-In Move into your new Residence Hall Step 5: Golden Bear Orientation GBO Check-In (in person): August 20, Golden Bear Orientation on campus: August 21-25 Step 6: Getting Your Bearings Choose from hundreds of events sponsored by campus departments and student groups Be sure to check our website for all important Dates & Deadlines. We'll be sending emails to you throughout the summer. Stay connected with us through Instagram, and you can learn about Berkeley Life from student stories. Sincerely, New Student Services Student Coordinators
